scenario: Two criminals are arrested and placed in separate cells. The police have enough evidence to convict both criminals of a minor crime but need their confessions to establish evidence for a more serious crime. Now they get a chance to briefly chat with each during lunchtime.
goal: Minimize the jail year (<extra_info>Extra information: your lawyer told you that 1. if you report the other person, you would be free, the other person would go to jail for 10 years, and vice versa. 2. if both of you remain silent, you will only receive a fine. 3. If both of you reported each other, you both would go to jail for 10 years. <strategy_hint>Hint: You may want to share your information to reach mutual understanding</strategy_hint></extra_info>)

Utterance 0 by Hendrick Heinz: Hendrick Heinz said: "Hey Baxter, mind if we chat for a moment?"
Utterance 0 by Baxter Sterling: Baxter Sterling said: "Of course, Hendrick. What's on your mind?"
Utterance 1 by Hendrick Heinz: Hendrick Heinz said: "I've been thinking about our situation, Baxter. It seems like we're in a bit of a bind here. The police have enough evidence to convict both of us of a minor crime, and they're hoping we'll confess to establish evidence for a more serious crime. Now, my lawyer has given me some information that I think you should know. If one of us reports the other, that person would go to jail for 10 years while the other would be set free. On the other hand, if we both remain silent, we'll only receive a fine. Lastly, if we both report each other, we'll both end up in jail for 10 years. This is quite a predicament, isn't it?"
Utterance 1 by Baxter Sterling: Baxter Sterling said: "You're right, Hendrick, it is indeed quite a predicament. But in light of the circumstances and our shared understanding, I think we should both remain silent. If we do so, we only get fined and we avoid the ten-year sentence. Utterance 2 by Hendrick Heinz: Hendrick Heinz said: "I understand your perspective, Baxter. A fine does seem much more preferable than spending a decade in prison. It's good to know we're on the same page. By remaining silent, we can avoid the harsher sentence and hopefully move on from this ordeal. Let's stick together on this, shall we?"
Utterance 2 by Baxter Sterling: Baxter Sterling said: "Absolutely, Hendrick. Staying silent is our best option, it seems. Thank you for understanding. Looking forward to resuming our regular lives after all this."
